page.title: 20THE GROSMONT WALK
page.content: This{walk around Grosmont}was devised by the children of Grosmont school. The{total distance is 2.323km}and it took{1.25hrs.There are nine points of {interest}on this walk. 1.The Village Square and Town Hall. 2.Bee hives,wooden stile and trees. 3.Stone bridge and Lower Tresenny Farm. 4.Tresenny Brook with its wildlife. 5.Sally Ruck's lane with many wild flowers like Stichwort and Chervil. 6.The Early English Church of St.Nicholas. 7.The Norman Castle and bird life. 8.Garway Hill and River Monnow Valley. 9.Grosmont School built in 1877. Points 4-6 are{not suitable for old {age pensioners or disabled people}to walk between.Copies of the{GROSMONT {WALK }are available at the Post Office
